meanings.definition: The act or process of disrupting or being disrupted.
meanings.sent1: The disruption of the class by the loud noise made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected power outage caused a disruption in the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The disruption of the squirrel stealing snacks from the picnic was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The disruption of the ant trail by the rain was like a sudden roadblock.
meanings.sent5: The disruption of the alarm clock ringing was so startling that it woke up everyone in the house.

meanings.definition: Something that disrupts or causes disruption.
meanings.sent1: The new construction site was a disruption to the peaceful neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The barking dog was a disruption during the quiet study session.
meanings.sent3: The disruption of the cat knocking over the vase was both frustrating and funny.
meanings.sent4: The disruption of the traffic jam was like a giant puzzle blocking the road.
meanings.sent5: The disruption of the phone ringing during the movie made everyone jump in surprise.
